Speaking with Matt Lauer on The Today Show Tuesday, former American Idol judge, Simon Cowell , admitted that he doesn't regularly watch American Idol now that he is back in the UK involved in other projects. It's on a different time here in the UK, Mr. Simon Cowell said.`` I watched some clips last week to get up to speed, and it looked good.'' been CEO for nearly a decade. He will now take over as executive chairman. We'll have more for you soon, but in the meantime, here's Eric Schmidt in his own words. When I joined Google in 2001 I never imagined-even in my wildest dreams-that we would get as far, as fast as we have today. Search has quite literally changed people's lives-increasing the collective sum of the world's knowledge and revolutionizing advertising in the process. And our emerging businesses-display, Android, YouTube and Chrome-are on fire. Of course, like any successful organization we've had our fair share of good luck, but the entire team-now over 24,000 Googlers globally-deserves most of the credit. outlook is bright. But as Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated. So Larry Page , Sergey and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and

making the 2011 Dodge Grand Caravan and Chrysler Town and Country this week.`` We need to completely rethink the minivan,'' CEO Sergio Marchionne said Tuesday at the Canadian plant where Chrysler's minivans are made. We need to retain all its functionality but make it much more versatile. Sergio Marchionne said that could mean new products that can still carry a lot of people but won't look like traditional minivans. CBS News reports that Dodge-Chrysler is seriously rethinking minivans as an automotive form factor, and that the company plans to completely redesign the iconic American family hauler. We need to seriously rethink the minivan, said Sergio Marchionne , CEO of Chrysler, in a recent ABC interview.`` We need to retain all its functionality but make it much more versatile. Saying his`` heart was in Indiana,'' Mike Pence said he would continue to meet with the good and strong and opinionated people of this state before deciding his next move. During a question-and-answer session, Mike Pence said his proudest moment as a congressman came when he helped a Muncie mother avoid deportation to her home country of Sierra Leone.
